alert.note: Alert for Osage; Pawnee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 04 at 2:32PM CST until March 05 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: .A dry line will move into western portions of Osage and Pawnee counties Saturday afternoon, with rapidly falling humidity and gusty west to southwest winds. The dry line may move as far east as a Nowata to Okemah line by late afternoon or early evening, and this would result in rapidly deteriorating fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CST SATURDAY FOR VERY DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR OSAGE AND PAWNEE COUNTIES... The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon to 8 PM CST Saturday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...In Oklahoma, Osage, and Pawnee counties. * WIND...Gusty west to southwest wind at 25 to 40 mph. * HUMIDITY...Afternoon RH values falling into the 15 to 25 percent range. * TEMPERATURE...Unseasonably warm conditions with highs around 80 degrees. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that a dangerous combination of weather conditions and dry vegetation is expected within 24 hours, favoring rapid growth and spread of any wildfires. The primary weather factors include stronger winds, lower humidities, and warmer temperatures.
